Hi J.B.,
 
I will explain from the start itself.
I am using JFCUnit, which is an extension to JUnit.
I am writing Automated Functional TestCases for our Swing-based GUI.
And finally I am adding them in one TestSuite.
 
My setUp() brings up the GUI and tearDown() brings it down.
I want all my functional TestCases to be execute in the same GUI.
Thus the requirement is not to call setUp() for every TestCase.
But it was not possible, as I was using the JUnit, so I have one boolean
variable which I set to true, once my GUI is up.
and before executing setUp() I check this variable.
Initially its set to false, so it beings-up the GUI first time.
Later on, the GUI is up, thus its true, and setUp() will not try to
bring-up the GUI again.
 
Similarly tearDown() also checks for the same variable and doesn't
brings down the GUI, if this variable is true.
So if I want to bring-down my GUI, I override tearDown() in my TestCase
class, and set that variable to false and call super.tearDown().
So it brings-down my GUI.
 
And my Final requirement is to run all these functional TestCases
repetitively.
I believe I explained what you want to know.
 
With Regards,
Rakesh.

Rakesh:

Can you tell us more about the environment you have that requires this 
complex and expensive environment setup? What kind of environment is it,

and perhaps more importantly, how did it get to be that way?
